subject: Writing
title: Braille: Reading by Touch
description: A short lesson to help you apply Braille: Reading by Touch.

hook.text: A blind 15-year-old boy adapted a military code into a reading system. It's still used 200 years later.

buildup.text: Louis Braille lost his sight at three. At school, he learned a military 'night writing' system of raised dots.

discovery.text: He simplified it into a six-dot cell system that could represent any letter, number, or musical note.

twist.text: Schools resisted Braille for decades â€” sighted teachers preferred embossed Roman letters blind students found harder.

climax.text: Braille eventually won and became the universal tactile writing system, empowering millions of blind readers.

punchline.text: A teenager turned darkness into a language of dots.

quiz.question: What was Louis Braille's system based on?
